datasets.name: Pediatric Cancer Mutation
datasets.intro:
The Pediatric dataset consists of somatic variants and tumor RNA-seq data shown in the protein view. The dataset is comprised of the GRCh37/hg19 genome as well as data from the Pediatric Cancer Genome Project (PCGP), NCI Target cohort, the Pan-TARGET study (PMID: 29489755), and the Shanghai Children's Medical Center T-ALL cohort (PMID: 32632335). A liftover of genomic variants and gene internals created the GRCh/hg38 dataset.

Read more about ProteinPaint data releases.

datasets.name: Pediatric2 GenomePaint
datasets.intro:
The Pediatric2 dataset expanded the original Pediatric dataset with non-coding variants and expression data in GenomePaint. The additional data includes Genome for Kids (PMID: 34301788), Shanghai Children's Medical Center relapsed ALL cohort (PMID: 32632335), St Jude's Clinical cancer genomic profiling by three-platform sequencing study (PMID: 30262806), and St Jude's Pan-neuroblastoma analysis data study (PMID: 33056981).

Read more about ProteinPaint data releases.

datasets.name: NCI GDC
datasets.intro:
The NCI's Genomic Data Commmons (GDC) coagulates data from NCI-supported programs, such as TCGA and TARGET.

Read more about GDC data sources.

datasets.name: CIViC
datasets.intro: The Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer is "an open-source platform for crowdsourced and expert-moderated cancer variant curation." Supported by the NIH, NHGRI, and NCI, CIViC is a richly curated oncology dataset (PMID: 28138153).

datasets.name: Survivorship Study
datasets.intro:
The survivorship dataset contains clinical, genomic, and patient-reported data from the St. Jude Life study (SJLife) and Childhood Cancer Survivor Study (CCSS). The interface offers data analysis tools like regression analysis (linear, logistic, and Cox) and interactive statistical plots.

To change to the CCSS data or see combined data from both studies, click on the COHORT tab at the top, and select the desired dataset(s).
